data.title: SocketIO: Receive JSON
Allow input '\n' on desktop.
data.body: Android and iOS are allow input '\n' so should desktop.

data.title: SocketIO: Emit JSON
data.body:
Currently it's not possible to emit JSON with the native implementation of SocketIO. 

With the official JS client I can emit JSON like:

``` js
io.emit('infos', { name: 'hans' });
```

And this is what the server will receive. 

```
engine:ws received "42["infos",{"name":"hans"}]"
```

The cocos2dx implementation only supports `std::string` as argument and this:

``` c++
client->emit("infos", "{\"name\":\"hans\"}");
```

Will lead to:

```
engine:ws received "42["infos","{\"name\":\"hans\"}"]"
```

This is a bit annoying, as, on the server, I need to call `JSON.parse` manually **AND** the server is no longer compatible with both the official JS client and the cocos2dx client (one backend for ios/android apps and html5). 

A possible solution for this could be to emit full `rapidjson` (already included in cocos2dx) objects:

``` c++
void SIOClient::emit(const std::string& eventname, const rapidjson::Document& json);
```

And/or a new method that allows the user to construct the JSON string manually:

``` c++
void SIOClient::emitJson(const std::string& eventname, const std::string& json);
```

I think the best solution would be to implement both new methods, because:
- `emitJson` would be the fastest solution with 100% control for the user (craft the json string by hand vs construction a `rapidjson` object)
- `emit + rapidjson` is a very nice addition that does no harm

**NOTE**: As soon as we implement #14619, we should support JSON objects there too. Please have a look [at this example](https://gist.github.com/michaelcontento/b1b9d7cf18b8c30f6bad) to see what is possible with the official JS client/server. Those are the features that one might expect from the native SocketIO client too.

data.title: CCEAGLView is not transparent
data.body:
Hi, I'm currently developer a Cocos2d-x Javascript project.
I was trying to use `VideoPlayer` and put it behind the cocos2d `GLView`, so I created a another `UIView` which index lower than cocos2d's.
The code in AppController.mm is:
![2015-12-09 4 19 50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8981679/11680063/b49714c0-9e90-11e5-955d-c91a49ec39d1.png)

(aaa is the `UIView` I will put `VideoPlayer` view later)
I set the _backgroundColor_ of _aaa_ to yellow color.
But the result wasnt right.
I also had some property set as follows:
![2015-12-09 4 19 58](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8981679/11680019/5ab24b1e-9e90-11e5-8380-ec4713d03f73.png)

If the _backgroundColor_ of `EAGLView` is transparent, then it should be all yellow except for the cocos2d `Sprite`, right?
The result from above code is:
![2015-12-09 4 25 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8981679/11680094/e29426d8-9e90-11e5-9c88-41e0227f2f23.png)
But...if I add a layer like :
![2015-12-09 4 26 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8981679/11680104/f170889a-9e90-11e5-8067-659f5ceca31e.png)
The result became:
![2015-12-09 4 26 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8981679/11680110/f80bdb14-9e90-11e5-9cbb-fc3ef0b310ec.png)

Please help me out with this.
Thanks in advance.

data.title: SocketIO: Custom path
SocketIO: Custom acknowledgements
SocketIO: Automatically reconnect
data.body:
As [described here](http://socket.io/docs/client-api/#manager%28url:string,-opts:object%29), the official JS client of SocketIO comes with a quite simple solution to reconnect on connection lost. 

It would be awesome if the cocos2dx native implementation of SocketIO would do the same and we could get a comparable behaviour between native and JS.

2. Fix scale9 enabled button clone size issue.
3. Fix #12249 Note: All the scale9 enabled widget has similar issue with 12249

data.title: UI::Widget - add separate "focused" sprite and state
data.body:
Right now UI Widgets don't differentiate between their "focused" state and their "pressed" state. This causes confusion with controller based UI navigation. They need a separate state and a separate sprite for focused state. The sprite should also be settable from Cocos Studio.
This is present in Unity as well.

data.title: fix horizontal clamp and shrink issue
Bug fix & make test case more clear.
data.body:
1. In CameraBackgroundSkyBoxBrush _actived and _textureValid should set true as default, otherwise will cause user get wrong display status.
2. "Enable Wrap" check box in "31:Node: Label - New API -> 55:Resize content Test" is not used, so set it to disabled, won't let user to change it.
3. When set blank texture to UISlider or UISlider button, use resetRender function to clear texture, use init with blank file name will cause error.

@zilongshanren Please review this PR.
